meanings.definition: The act of twisting or bending out of shape.
meanings.sent1: During the yoga class, the instructor demonstrated various contortions to improve flexibility.
meanings.sent2: The contortions of the acrobat amazed the audience with their flexibility and strength.
meanings.sent3: The contortions of the balloon animal made the children giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: Her face contorted in pain as she tried to squeeze through the narrow opening.
meanings.sent5: The contortions of the tree branches in the wind created a mesmerizing dance.

meanings.definition: A twisted or bent shape or position.
meanings.sent1: The contortions of the pretzel made it difficult to untangle.
meanings.sent2: The contortions of the wire sculpture gave it a unique and artistic look.
meanings.sent3: The contortions of the tangled headphones always amused him.
meanings.sent4: The contortions of the mountain road made for a challenging drive.
meanings.sent5: The contortions of the old tree trunk showed its age and history.
